facts: The Great Wall of China is made of many connected walls and fortifications built over centuries to help defend against invasions.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was built for the 1889 World's Fair and was once criticized by some people who thought it looked strange.
The Taj Mahal in India is a white marble mausoleum built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.
Machu Picchu in Peru is an Inca city high in the Andes Mountains that was largely unknown to the outside world until the early 1900s.
The Colosseum in Rome could hold tens of thousands of spectators who came to watch public events like gladiator fights in ancient times.
The Statue of Liberty was a gift from France to the United States and was dedicated in 1886 in New York Harbor.
The Pyramids of Giza in Egypt are more than 4,500 years old and are among the largest stone structures ever built.
